isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - HOOD, GRILLE, AND FENDERS - 5000i, 9000i - ADJUSTMENTS - RADIATOR ADJUSTMENT

svcprocinfo.para: The position of the radiator affects the hood tilt angle and hood clearance. Adjust the angle of the radiator to provide clearance for the hood, grille, recirculation seals, charge air cooler and condenser on those models that have an adjustable radiator.

svcsubproc.title: Radiator Adjustment on 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i (SFA), 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with Tilt Hood
svcsubproc.para: The position of the radiator is fixed and cannot be adjusted on the following vehicles, 9100 i (SBA), 9200 i (SBA), 9400 i (SBA), 9900 i (SFA) and 9900 ix (SFA) and 5500 i, 5600 i (SBA) and 5900 i (SFA) with tilt hood.

svcsubproc.title: Radiator Adjustment 5600 i (SBA) with Optional Butterfly Hood
svcsubproc.para: The correct spacing for hood-to-cowl and/or hood-to-radiator shell dimensions are 1/2 inch (12.7 mm) in both places.
The correct radiator shell-to-cowl dimension is 50 inches (1,270 mm).
Adjust the radiator shell assembly as follows.

para.title: TO INCREASE the radiator shell-to-cowl dimension, lengthen the stay rod.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 56 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Release the hood latches and lift both sides of the hood up to allow access to the adjustment components, hex nuts, spring lock washers, flat washers, stay rod insulators and stay rod insulator bushing (Items 4 thru 12) at the radiator stay rod mounting bracket (Item 2) and hex nuts, spring lock washers, flat washers, stay rod insulators and stay rod insulator bushing (Items 13 thru 21) at the chassis stay rod mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.
Loosen hex nut (Item 4) and move it forward at the radiator stay rod mounting bracket (Item 2), driver side shown.

Slide the adjustment components, spring lock washer, flat washer and stay rod insulator (Items 5, 6, and 7) forward against hex nut (Item 4). Then move forward the stay rod insulator bushing (Item 12), stay rod insulator, flat washer and spring lock washer (Items 11, 10, and 9) by running hex nut (Item 8) up the stay rod (Item 1) toward the radiator stay rod mounting bracket (Item 2) and tighten, check dimensions between the hood-to-cowl and/or hood-to-radiator shell and radiator shell-to-cowl for the proper spacing listed above, driver side shown.
If required to meet the dimensions for the proper spacing, loosen hex nut (Item 13) and move it rearward at the chassis stay rod mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.

Slide the adjustment components, spring lock washer, flat washer and stay rod insulator (Items 14, 15, and 16) rearward against hex nut (Item 13). Then move rearward the stay rod insulator bushing (Item 21), stay rod insulator, flat washer and spring lock washer (Items 20, 19, and 18) by running hex nut (Item 17) down the stay rod (Item 1) toward the chassis stay rod mounting bracket (Item 3) and tighten, check dimensions between the hood-to-cowl and/or hood-to-radiator shell and radiator shell-to-cowl for the proper spacing listed above, driver side shown.
Repeat procedure for passenger side stay rod.
Close both driver and passenger side hoods and latch both latches on each hood.

para.title: TO DECREASE the radiator shell-to-cowl dimension, shorten the stay rod.

svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 56 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Release the hood latches and lift both sides of the hood up to allow access to the adjustment components, hex nuts, spring lock washers, flat washers, stay rod insulators and stay rod insulator bushing (Items 4 thru 12) at the radiator stay rod mounting bracket (Item 2) and hex nuts, spring lock washers, flat washers, stay rod insulators and stay rod insulator bushing (Items 13 thru 21) at the chassis stay rod mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.
Loosen hex nut (Item 8) and move it rearward at the radiator stay rod mounting bracket (Item 2), driver side shown.

Slide the adjustment components, spring lock washer, flat washer and stay rod insulator (Items 9, 10, and 11) rearward against hex nut (Item 8). Then move rearward the stay rod insulator bushing (Item 12), stay rod insulator, flat washer and spring lock washer (Items 7, 6, and 5) by running hex nut (Item 4) down the stay rod (Item 1) toward the radiator stay rod mounting bracket (Item 2) and tighten, check dimensions between the hood-to-cowl and/or hood-to-radiator shell and radiator shell-to-cowl for the proper spacing listed above, driver side shown.
If required to meet the dimensions for the proper spacing, loosen hex nut (Item 17) and move it forward at the chassis stay rod mounting bracket (Item 3), driver side shown.

Slide the adjustment components, spring lock washer, flat washer and stay rod insulator (Items 18, 19, and 20) forward against hex nut (Item 17). Then move rearward the stay rod insulator bushing (Item 21), stay rod insulator, flat washer and spring lock washer (Items 16, 15, and 14) by running hex nut (Item 13) up the stay rod (Item 1) toward the chassis stay rod mounting bracket (Item 3) and tighten, check dimensions between the hood-to-cowl and/or hood-to-radiator shell and radiator shell-to-cowl for the proper spacing listed above, driver side shown.
Repeat procedure for passenger side stay rod.
Close both driver and passenger side hoods and latch both latches on each hood.
